PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: UV - vis absorption spectra of PSFDTBT in THF solution and in film are shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| UV |
| vis |
| absorption |
| spectra |
| PSFDTBT |
| THF |
| solution |
| film |

Note:

* UV and vis are both property names, as they refer to specific properties of the material (ultraviolet and visible light absorption, respectively).
* absorption is not a property name, but rather a process that is being described.
* spectra is a plural noun referring to the graphical representation of the absorption properties.
* PSFDTBT is a material name and not a property name.
* THF is a solvent name and not a property name.
* solution and film are not property names, but rather ways of describing the state of the material.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| UV |
| vis |
| absorption |
| spectra |

The following entities do not clearly refer to material properties and were removed:

* PSFDTBT (material name)
* THF (solvent name)
* solution (state of the material)
* film (state of the material)

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: UV - vis absorption spectra of PSFDTBT in THF solution and in film are shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| UV |
| vis |
| absorption |
| spectra |
| PSFDTBT |
| THF |
| solution |
| film |

Note:

* UV and vis are property values representing ultraviolet and visible light absorption, respectively.
* absorption is a property value representing the ability of a material to absorb light.
* spectra is a property value representing the distribution of light absorbed by a material across different wavelengths.
* PSFDTBT is a property value representing the material polystyrene-b-furfuryl alcohol-b-tert-butyl acrylate.
* THF is a property value representing the solvent tetrahydrofuran.
* solution and film are property values representing the states of the material, specifically, in solution and in film forms, respectively.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| UV |
| vis |
| absorption |
| spectra |

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property":

* PSFDTBT (material name)
* THF (solvent name)
* solution (state of material)
* film (state of material)

The remaining entities - UV, vis, absorption, and spectra - are related to the properties of the material and can be used to describe its optical properties.
